title: (x) Louis Prima poster lettering - various alternatives {Florian}
content:
I know this was hand-lettered, but I know there’s a font that looks similar, especially the S. Dom Casual was the first thing that came to mind, but it’s not too close. Any ideas?

thanks!

Jonathan

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [prima2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100101220843/http:/typophile.com/files/prima2.jpg) | 99.37 KB |
author: jonathanhughes

comments.content:
Hi Jonathan,

what about these?  
 [House Upright](http://web.archive.org/web/20100101220843/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/signpainterfontkit/viewfonts)  
 [Fink Casual](http://web.archive.org/web/20100101220843/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/ratfinkfonts/viewfonts)  
 [Jefferson aka Freehand 575](http://web.archive.org/web/20100101220843/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/freehand-575/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D72%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DLOUIS%2520PRIMA!%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D26)  
More casual brush sans typefaces in [this FontList](http://web.archive.org/web/20100101220843/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/casual_brush_sans/?&sample_text=LOUIS%20PRIMA!&sample_size=60)  
F

Thanks!

Too bad the House stuff is only available in the Sign Painter’s kit. Upright or Brush would’ve ben perfect.

It looks like it’ll have to be Freehand 575.

thanks again.
